questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
Which tag is used to insert an image in HTML?
What is the purpose of the <head> tag in HTML?
questions.answer: It contains metadata and links to scripts and stylesheets.

sections.title: JavaScript Overview
bullets: JavaScript is primarily used to add interactivity and dynamic behavior to websites.
Common keywords for declaring variables: let, const, or var.
Expression '2' + 2 results in '22' due to string concatenation.
Functions can be defined using: function myFunction() { }
The addEventListener method attaches an event handler to an element.

sections.title: Web Accessibility Essentials
bullets: WCAG stands for Web Content Accessibility Guidelines.
Alt text describes images for screen readers and improves accessibility.
The aria-label attribute helps screen readers understand the purpose of a link.
Use heading tags (h1â€“h6) in order to provide a logical structure for screen readers.
Color contrast ensures readability for users with visual impairments.

sections.title: The Agile Manifesto
bullets: Individuals and interactions over processes and tools.
Working software over comprehensive documentation.
Customer collaboration over contract negotiation.
Responding to change over following a plan.

sections.title: Core Aspects of Agility
bullets: Agility is the ability to respond rapidly and adaptively to change.
Encourages effective communication among stakeholders.
Involves the customer as part of the team.
Teams are self-organizing and in control of their work.
Focuses on rapid, incremental software delivery.

sections.title: Process Management
bullets: AI: A process is a program in execution, including program counter, registers, and variables.
The OS uses process scheduling to maximize CPU usage and reduce wait times.
Multitasking involves context switching between processes.

sections.title: Memory Management
bullets: AI: Memory management ensures each process has enough memory and prevents overlap.
Paging and segmentation help divide memory into manageable sections.
Virtual memory allows larger programs by using disk space as RAM overflow.

sections.title: File Systems
bullets: AI: File systems store and organize data on storage devices.
Common types include FAT, NTFS, ext4.
Each file has attributes like name, type, and access permissions.

sections.title: What is a Storyboard?
bullets: AI: A storyboard is a visual plan of a video or animation, showing scene-by-scene progression.
Traditionally hand-drawn but now often digital and more detailed.
It visually maps out the script and narrative flow.

sections.title: History of Storyboarding
bullets: AI: Storyboarding originated in the 1930s at Walt Disney Studios.
Used in the 1933 Disney short 'Three Little Pigs' and the 1939 film 'Gone with the Wind'.
Animator Webb Smith is credited with the concept of storyboarding.

sections.title: Why Storyboard?
bullets: AI: Storyboarding helps clearly communicate your video vision to others.
It streamlines production by planning shots, sequences, and visuals in advance.
Reduces revision time and increases production efficiency.

sections.title: Stages of Storyboarding
bullets: AI: Storyboarding typically follows three stages: Planning, Production, and Revision.
Each stage helps refine visual storytelling before final production.

sections.title: Storyboard Doâ€™s and Donâ€™ts
bullets: AI: Every scene must serve a purpose; avoid unnecessary camera movement.
Maintain clear animation and camera instructions; watch for jump cuts and composition.
Ensure strong posing, camera direction accuracy, and center-screen action.
Avoid complicated angles unless necessary; indicate light sources when relevant.

sections.title: Storyboard Software
bullets: AI: Storyboarder is a free, open-source tool ideal for low-budget projects.
Plot is another fast, free storyboard tool used by companies like WeightWatchers and Vistaprint.

sections.title: Conclusion
bullets: AI: Storyboarding is a crucial pre-production step that enhances communication, planning, and efficiency in video creation.
